ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend the course to any student looking to familiarize themselves with environmental issues in Africa.
I would strongly recommend this course to other students interested in the environmental history in Africa.

Yes I would definitely recommend this course. It allows students to have a deeper understanding of the African continent as a whole and understanding the environmental challenges faced by many African continent. I recommend it for all students interested in Africa regardless of their concentration.
A great opportunity to see how Africans managed their environment before and during colonialism, realise that questions and innovations for sustainability are precolonial.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course, and its readings gave me a much deeper appreciation for issues surrounding the environment in Africa. It will help inform my ideas about proper development policy in this context.
It opens up a window for me to obtain a primary understanding of environmental history in Africa

As a public health student this course really forced me to apply a well-rounded approach to development. It made me understand that the environmental history of Africa must be understood in order to create effective development policies in all areas.

The insights into African environmentalism will be useful for me in designing solutions for the continent and it's people. The history forms a perfect foundation for environmental education programs designed for the continent's youth because it will give them reasons personalise environmental stewardship.
